runs.comm: nice shape on a delivery that slants in with the angle and then shapes away on off stump. Pushed into the covers
much fuller this time, again decent pace and some curve away from the left-hander. Driven to mid-off this time.
speared down the leg side, Butt just needed to get a little tickle on that and it would've been four. Didn't touch it, though, and that's a wide
chopped down to third man, and Butt is off the mark. Big cheer from the crowd!

gone! Shahzaib goes first ball, Nannes strikes with his fifth ball of the innings! That was full and angling across the right-handed Shahzaib. He aimed an ambitious mow over mid-on but toe-ended it to give the fielder an easy catch. He didn't even have to move... First blood to Australia.
full, punched to cover

edged! But wide of the second slip, and played with soft-hands so may not have reached a third slip even if there had been one. Kamran picks up a single to third man, but he didn't look comfortable playing that...
not the greatest start, very quick indeed but hurled short and wide down the leg side
speared in to the pads this time, much fuller. Kamran is beaten for pace as the ball strikes him on the pad. Tait's searching for outswing but there hasn't been any so far
is Tait trying just a bit too hrd as he steams in? This one strays well down the leg side and that's another wide
short, and slashed through gully and down to third man. That was uppish, but well wide of any fielders
Butt presses half forward and taps the ball to point
back of a length again, and jammed down towards gully. They briefly think about the single, but the fielder was on to that in a flash
again slightly short on the off stump, Butt rocks back and tries to angle down to third man but finds the gully fielder once more
quick bouncer to finish the over, but that was slammed down very short and Butt got underneath it easily
on the legs, and Kamran aims a wristy flick down to fine leg
not great cricket from Australia, as Nannes sends one way down the leg side. Paine leapt to his right but couldn't get to it, and that'll be five wides!
full and pushed back to the bowler, who bends over but can't lay a hand on the ball, and they steal a single as mid-on runs round. Slightly sloppy once again
hammered! Kamran isn't intimidated by the short ball and leans back to murder a pull over deep midwicket. First boundary, and it's a good one
much better ball, landing on a testing length and tapped back to the bowler
good line again, nice and straight and tapped into the off side
flashing square drive! Nannes sends one down full and wide and Kamran sends the ball up and over point with a full swing of the blade. Pakistan are up and running again after the early wicket
full and fast, but fired at the legs and thumping into Butt's pad. They take a quick single, not a leg-bye as he got an edge on it
full toss wide of off, and slapped down to third man. He was aiming more through cover, but the ball just rushed on to him
pushed into the covers off the front foot
tucked off the hip straight to short fine leg, they set off straight away and that would've been very tight had the return throw been accurate
too straight, worked through the leg side and that'll be two
yorker, but well wide of off. Kamran jams the bat down but the ball squirts underneath it and he can't get a touch on it
pushed between cover and mid-off, and they take a quick single
on a length, just a hint of width outside off stump and Kamran sends the ball square as he pushes forward. Straight to point though

slower ball from Tait, but it's misdirected down the leg side, and that'll be another wide. Nine extras already in this innings. Tait isn't happy with himself there, shaking his head as he walks back to his mark

that's the Tait we know! Enough of these slower balls, Tait sends down a vicious  bouncer. Kamran plays a pull, but it's purely speculative. The ball was whizzing past his head almost before he was into the shot. Umpire calls one for the over
much fuller this time, but there's no swing and so Kamran has little trouble whipping it out to midwicket. David Hussey chases the ball down before the rope
flat-batted just over a leaping mid-on fielder! That'll be a boundary, but it was mighty close. Tait gives Kamran a wry smile
another slower ball to finish, but this one is on a length on off stump and is pushed back to the bowler
shot from Butt! He's strong through point and backward of square, and hits a full, wide ball very well off the front foot ... but straight to the point fielder
backs away to leg as Johnson digs one in short, Butt aims to slap the ball through cover but doesn't get close to timing it

intelligent shot! Johnson sent down a back-of-a-length delivery just outside off and Butt just opened the face on the blade to send it through the vacant slip area. Really well-placed, very fine and down to third man. Paine dives, but can't get close
good comeback from Johnson, who goes full and fast. Butt can only tap it back to the bowler
wide outside off, Butt cuts but again doesn't get a good connection. Still, picks up two as the ball rolls out to cover point
Johnson finds a little bit of wobble through the air in to Butt, who angles the ball down to shord third man to keep the strike
tapped to cover, and they take an easy single as Butt finds a gap
hurled down quicker outside off stump. Kamran goes down on bended knee and aims to slash the ball square, but is beaten
pushed down to long-on

tragedy for Kamran! Butt pushed the ball softly to point and Kamran set off for what would've been a tight single. Butt watches the ball and goes nowhere, though, and by the time Kamran turns and tries to scamper back the ball is thrown in and he's well short. Whose fault was that? I'm not sure, but that's a shame for Pakistan as Kamran was going really well

two wickets in two balls! Butt plays an uncharacteristic hack to leg, really just a hoick across the line and he's easily caught at deep midwicket. Perhaps he was rattled by the run-out, but was an ugly shot
driven down to long-on off the back foot to get off the mark
some turn first ball as he tucked to backward point
this one slides straight on and is pushed to cover
swiped down to long-on, a single and so Afridi's on strike

gone first ball! Smith sent down a full toss, dead straight, and Afridi was struck on the front pad as he went down to sweep. That was right in front, and quickly given. An audible groan from the crowd as the finger went up.
hops onto the back foot and slashes to backward point, straight to the fielder
punched out to deep cover off the back foot, and he's off the mark
nudged out to midwicket
slapped to straight midwicket in the circle
pushed straight on the leg side this time, and he picks up a single to long-on
wristily worked from wide of off out to deep midwicket
well-bowled, fast full and straight. Dug out back to the bowler
aesthetically-pleasing square drive as Hussey sends this one full and wide, but it's out to the cover sweeper and so just the one
floated up nicely on middle and off, and driven down to long-off
Umar charges down the track and aims a massive, head-in-the-air mow on the leg side. He's lucky to get an inside edge on that as the ball rolls to leg
again worked down to long-on, steady stuff from Malik

Umar is on the attack! He comes down the track again, this time he plays a much better shot, leading the the left elbow and lifting the ball handsomely over straight long-on! That's gone several rows back, right out of the middle
and another! Straight down the ground this time, and this one's even bigger! Brutal, straight hit from Umar, wonderful to see
beaten by the turn! Umar went back and across the ball turned across him, swiping inside the line
Malik joins in with a superb lofted drive over cover! He dances down the track and slapped the ball up and over cover, placing it to perfection to pick the gap and find the boundary
Pakistan are on the counterattack now! Intelligent stuff from Malik, very subtle as he stays deep in the crease this time, using the pace on the ball to run it down fine to third man
single down to long on to rotate the strike
Umar! Square driven to perfection, Warner sprinted round and dived, but couldn't cut that off. Pakistan motoring now
slapped imperiously down to long-on! That was hit so hard, the ball almost took out Malik at the other end, and raced so quickly that it had the beating of the wide long-on fielder
nudged through the leg side... oh no, he's over-stepped! That's criminal for a spinner. Free-hit coming up!
heaved out to deep midwicket, couldn't get enough on it so just the one
punched to the man at cover
back-of-a-length and on the hips, tucked behind square on the leg side and they take a quick single
well, Umar was really winding up - getting that left leg out the way - as Nannes gathered, and it must have put the bowler off as he sends one very wide on the off side

what a shot! That had the mark of genius, Umar gets right across to the off side this time and paddles a full toss from Nannes up and over the 'keeper and down to a very fine fine leg. He watched the ball right on to the bat, a brave premeditated shot but he executed it so well
mature stuff from Umar, who follows that shot up with a tip-and-run dink to cover
Malik gives himself some room and slashes up and over gully, down to third man for another four! Tait was the man down there, and he couldn't cut it off

now, what's happened here? Nannes sent down a slower cutter, Malik tried to guide it down to third man and appeared to get an edge on it. As Paine dives forward to take the catch they sprint through for a single ... The Umpire has not given that as byes, so has he hit it? Did Paine take the catch cleanly as he tumbled forward? ... Yes! He has! After several replays, they decide that Paine managed to get the glove underneath that one, and Australia have broken a very threatening partnership between Malik and Umar
slung down on a length on off stump, tapped back to the bowler
Umar clears the front leg and thumps the ball through cover, but there's a fielder out there to cut it off
Razzaq hops onto the back foot and taps the ball to cover
slanting into the pads, Razzaq gets across and sends the ball to short fine leg. Off the pad

Umar is playing an absolute blinder here, he's seeing the ball so well. He opened up the stance to carve through the off side but then picked up the length - it was a yorker outside off - and just angled the face of the bat to pick a boundary down to third man. Great shot
slashed to third man again, this time to the fielder's right, and it's cut off
and he does so, chopping the ball to backward point
Umar gives him the charge straight away, Smith sees him coming though and sends the ball down very wide on the off side. Umar slashes out to deep cover - but the stumping was on there had he missed
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
slightly wider this time, but cracked straight to point
he will get the single this time, punching the ball out to deep cover
bouncer from Smith! Umar could not have been expecting that, but he's seeing the ball so well that he just rocks back and hammers a pull out to deep midwicket
on a length and straight, tapped to long-on
wow, what a talent... Umar gets across to off and lifts the ball up and over square leg. Monstrous strike, all in the wrists as he paddle-flicks it out of the middle of the bat
fifty for Umar, and he gets it in style! Pulled off the front foot to fine leg, the fielder was up and he beat him to pick up the boundary. Consecutive fifties for Umar against Australia!
yorker outside off, driven out to deep point for a couple
well, that would've gone into orbit if he'd hit it. Massive heave to leg, but the ball squirts off the inside edge onto the pad and goes nowhere...
run down to third man for the single, and he keeps the strike
off the outer half of the bat past Paine, and Razzaq calls him through
clipped through midwicket
Umar dances down and takes the ball on the full, getting a good connection but straight to long-on. Along the ground.
Razzaq waits in the crease and slashes out to cover point
Razzaq tries to go over long-on, the ball comes off the toe of the bat and drops well short of the fielder

Umar is using his feet so well, every ball. Again he comes down, Smith was expecting it and fired one very wide of off and Umar responded by sending the ball through cover with a resounding crack of the bat. Full swing of the blade, and he places it well to pick up a boundary

clatter! Tait has made a mess of Razzaq's stumps with the perfect reverse-swinging yorker at high pace! Razzaq as looking for the full ball to thump through cover, but he was beaten for pace and couldn't get the bat down in time. Tait strikes!
well, a case of ball hitting bat there. Tait fires one down on a length and angling in to Aamer, he thrusts the bat at the ball and is lucky to hit it
much fuller, and wide of off this time. Aamer is beaten for pace on the drive, the ball flying through to Paine as he completes the shot
off the leading edge as he shapes to push to midwicket, and he picks up a single out to deep cover

Umar went across to off as Tait sent down the yorker ...  but he's lost his line and sends the ball down the leg side. Paine can't get across in time, though he gets a touch to it, and that's gone to the boundary!

spicy meatball! Tait digs one in very short, and Umar smelled that one is it leapt up at his grille. He flung the bat out at it, though, and to his credit appeared to keep his eye on the ball to pick up a single to square leg
well, nice looking drive from Aamer as Tait goes back over the wicket
clipped through midwicket, and some very quick running gets Aamer two!
great running again, the ball was cracked down to long-on but Umar was so quick between the wickets, he was rushing back for the second almost before it got to the fielder
tries to slash the ball square, beaten
tapped into space in the covers, and Umar gets strike
flung down very fast and very full, Umar jams the ball to point and they take a single. That was a quick ball, for a spinner!
Aamer backs away to leg as Hussey sends one down short, wide and quick. Beaten on the cut once again
Tait snakes a pinpoint reverse-swinging yorker down and Umar digs it out to point
Aamer manages to lay bat on one, sending it down to third man off the toe-edge

castled him! Great thinking from Tait, Umar must have been expecting a thunderbolt the way he charged in, but instead he sends down a slow cutter. Umar was through the shot before the ball reached him, and looked back to see his stumps disturbed.
dug in halfway down, Gul takes his eye off it, ducking and turning away. Well, that's given as a wide but that's a bit harsh! That barely missed the helmet
much fuller, tapped to long-on
Aamer backs away and drills a full ball down to long-off
slower ball, very full and Gul picked it and waited on the shot. He sends the ball down to long-on, so just the single again

back-of-a-length, Gul swivels to pull and top-edges very high in the air ... dropped by Tait running in from fine leg! He got underneath the ball in good time, tried to catch it fingers up in the Aussie way but got himself into an awkward position, the ball hitting the palm and bobbling out
very full, jammed to cover and they take a quick single
this time he's nailed the pull! Muscly shot from Gul, little more than a short-arm jab but the ball sails into the crowd at deep midwicket
short again - even shorter than the one before. Gul tries to go up and over third man but can't get bat on it
slapped to wide mid-on

manic! Aamer pushed the ball straight, mid-on charged round to cut it off and fired a return at the striker's end. The ball hits the stumps and they charge through for another one is it ricochets into space ...  but Gul is caught short at the other end as Nannes palms the ball onto the stumps. Just the one run to finish then
